result.execSummary:
The defendant Charity L. Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charity L. Hill is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charity L. Hill was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Bond continues until Defendant signs up for Probation.
Defendant to sign up within 1 week, if unable to do so today November 10, 2014.
Probation may be transferred to Richland County.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Erin Drost, Clerk: Warrick, ADA: Kevin Gehler, DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad and DF: Charity L. Hill appeared. Case called 3:39 pm.  Count 1 amended to misd. theft - 943.20(1)(a).  ADA to submit restitution w/in 30 days.  Court finds the def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives constitutional rights.  Guilty plea entered. Def understands.  Court finds the def freely, voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the def guilty to amended count 1.  Count 2 dismissed. Atty Smestad makes statement to the court. Def has an AODA scheduled. Def makes statements to the court. 

Court orders:  S/W 1 year probation
Conditions of probation:
AODA evaluation and follow thru w/recommendations
No Contact w/Derek Dusk
Letter of apology w/in 30 days to Derek Dusk
Court costs $243.00 - payable through probation
Restitution to be determined w/in the next 30 days, if any.
Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

20 days to appeal.  Bond continues until def signs up for probation. Sign up within 1 week if unable to do so today.  Probation may be transferred to Richland County, WI. 

Adjourned at 3:49 pm

Preliminary hearing on August 26, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Derrick Dusk or property.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
